metadata.Title: CVE-2019-18805 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description: An issue was discovered in net/ipv4/sysctl_net_ipv4.c in the Linux kernel before 5.0.11. There is a net/ipv4/tcp_input.c signed integer overflow in tcp_ack_update_rtt() when userspace writes a very large integer to /proc/sys/net/ipv4/tcp_min_rtt_wlen, leading to a denial of service or possibly unspecified other impact, aka CID-19fad20d15a6.

notes.Note: sbeattie> requires write access to /proc/sys/net/ipv4/tcp_min_rtt_wlen ... which is probably possible with unprivileged user namespaces; Marking when this sysctl was added as the break line

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-aws: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
